name: Marseille
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bouillabaisse is so sacred in Marseille that a 'Bouillabaisse Charter' exists - established in 1980 by top chefs, it mandates that authentic bouillabaisse must contain at least 4 types of Mediterranean rock fish and be served tableside in a specific ritual!

hero_dishes.origin_story: Created by fishermen using unsellable bony fish. Must include rascasse (scorpionfish), and is served in two courses - broth then fish

hero_dishes.name: Panisse
hero_dishes.description: Fried chickpea flour sticks, similar to thick fries
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Marseille street food since the 19th century - crispy outside, creamy inside. Brought by Italian immigrants
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Street vendors, La Pizzeria Chez Etienne, markets

hero_dishes.name: Navettes
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created to honor the boat that brought Saintes-Maries to Provence. The shape represents their vessel
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Four des Navettes (since 1781), the oldest bakery in Marseille

hero_dishes.name: Pieds et Paquets
hero_dishes.description: Lamb tripe rolls (paquets) and sheep's feet cooked slowly with tomatoes and white wine
hero_dishes.origin_story: A robust ProvenÃ§al dish - nothing is wasted. Requires hours of slow cooking

food_culture_notes: Vieux Port fish market is best at 8am when fishermen return
North African influence strong - couscous and tajine popular
Noailles market is incredibly diverse - 'the belly of Marseille'
